description: ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF EXTENSION ON MAIN ROOF AND PART OF REAR WING
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match the original facing materials of the existing buildings in type, colour, dimensions and in the case of brickwork, bond, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order 1995 (or any other Order revoking or re-enacting this Order with or without modification) no windows or other openings other than those authorised as part of the development hereby approved shall be formed in the flank elevations of the roof extensions without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposal would result in the enlargement of a property in which there would not be a detrimental impact on visual or residentail amenity. The proposal accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.

Adopted Merton Unitary Development Plan (October 2003): 
BE.15 (New Buildings and Extensions; Daylight; Sunlight; Privacy; Visual Intrusions and Noise)
BE.22 (Design of New Development)
BE.23 (Alterations and Extensions to Buildings)
BE.24 (Roof Extensions and Dormer Windows).
